a.g: No one disputes concerning the signs of Allah except those who disbelieve, so be not deceived by their [uninhibited] movement throughout the land.

The people of Noah denied before them and the [disbelieving] factions after them, and every nation intended [a plot] for their messenger to seize him, and they disputed by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth. So I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.

Those [angels] who carry the Throne and those around it exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who have believed, [saying], "Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire.

Our Lord, and admit them to gardens of perpetual residence which You have promised them and whoever was righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their offspring. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
And protect them from the evil consequences [of their deeds]. And he whom You protect from evil consequences that Day - You will have given him mercy. And that is the great attainment."
Indeed, those who disbelieve will be addressed, "The hatred of Allah for you was [even] greater than your hatred of yourselves [this Day in Hell] when you were invited to faith, but you refused."

Muhammad ibn Ka'b said: The people of the Fire have five supplications to which Allah the Exalted responds in four, and when it comes to the fifth, they will never speak after it. They say: "Our Lord, You have caused us to die twice and given us life twice, so we have confessed our sins; is there any way out?" Then Allah the Exalted responds to them: "That is because when Allah alone was invoked, you disbelieved, but if others are associated with Him, you believe. So the judgment is with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great." Then they say: "Our Lord, delay us for a near term so that we may respond to Your call and follow the messengers." Allah the Exalted responds: "Did you not swear before that you would never cease?" Then they say: "Our Lord, bring us out so that we may do righteous deeds other than what we used to do." Allah the Exalted responds: "Did We not give you long enough life that whoever would be reminded could be reminded? And the warner came to you. So taste [the punishment], for the wrongdoers have no helper." Then they say: "Our Lord, our misfortune has overcome us, and we were a people astray. Our Lord, remove us from it; and if we return [to evil], we will be wrongdoers." Allah the Exalted responds: "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me." So they will never speak after that, and that is the utmost severity of the punishment.

And Allah the Exalted has made turning in repentance (al-Inabah) a condition for understanding and remembrance (al-Tadhkir), for He said: 'An insight and a reminder for every servant who turns in repentance (Muneeb)' (Quran 50:8). And that is because it draws from a hidden vein in the Soul (Nafs) and a nature concealed in the innate disposition (Tab') that hardly anyone can discern except the deep divers. As for the first cause: it is the repulsion of the pain of fear, because the one who is anxious with bad suspicion is addicted, and the human being, even if he is sufficient in the present, is long in hope and it occurs to his mind that the wealth in which his sufficiency lies might perish, so he needs another. And such a cause applies in the love of status, for he fears the humiliation of poverty and the humiliation of obscurity, so he seeks status to repel his fear with it, and this fear has no limit to stop at, therefore the love of status does not stop at a limit. So arrogance (Kibr) is an expression for the state occurring in the Soul (Nafs) from these beliefs, and it is also called pride (Izza) and self-glorification (Ta'azzum). Therefore, Ibn Abbas said regarding His saying, the Exalted: "Indeed, in their chests is nothing but arrogance (Kibr) which they will never attain" - he said: a greatness (Azama) they have not reached. Thus, he interpreted arrogance (Kibr) as that greatness (Azama). Then this pride (Izza) necessitates actions in the outward and inward which are fruits and that is called arrogance (Takabbur). For whenever his worth becomes great in his estimation relative to others, he belittles those beneath him, despises them, excludes them from himself, distances them, and elevates himself above sitting with them and eating with them. He sees that it is his right that they stand before him if his arrogance intensifies. If it is more severe than that, he disdains from employing them and does not deem them worthy to stand before him nor to serve his threshold. If it is less than that, then he scorns equality with them, precedes them in narrow paths, rises above them in gatherings, waits for them to initiate the greeting, considers their deficiency in fulfilling his needs improbable, and is amazed by it. If he argues or debates, he scorns responding to them; if admonished, he disdains acceptance; if he admonishes, he is harsh in advice; if something of his statement is refuted, he becomes angry; if he teaches, he does not show gentleness to the learners, humiliates them, rebukes them, imposes favors upon them, and uses them. He looks at the common people as if he looks at donkeys, considering them ignorant and belittling them.

And the worst type of arrogance (Kibr) is what prevents from benefiting from knowledge and accepting the truth and submitting to it, and in it came the verses which contain censure of arrogance (Kibr) and the arrogant ones (Mutakabbirun). Allah the Exalted said: "And the angels stretching forth their hands" up to His saying: "and you were arrogant (Tastakbirun) about His signs." Then He said: "Enter the gates of Hell (Jahannam), abiding therein. How wretched is the settlement of the arrogant ones (Mutakabbirun)." Then He informed that the most severely punished of the people of the Fire are the most insolent (Atiyyan) against Allah the Exalted, so He said: "Then We will surely extract from every faction those of them who were most insolent (Atiyyan) against the Most Merciful." And He said: "So those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are denying and they are arrogant (Mustakbirun)." And He the Mighty and Majestic said: "Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant (Istakbaru): 'If not for you, we would have been believers.'" And He said: "Indeed, those who are arrogant (Yastakbirun) about My worship will enter Hell (Jahannam) humiliated." And He said: "I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant (Yatakabbarun) in the earth without right." It is said in the interpretation (Tafsir): I will lift the understanding of the Quran from their hearts (Qulub), and in some interpretations (Tafasir) I will veil their hearts (Qulub) from the dominion (Malakut). And Ibn Juraij said: I will turn them away from reflecting upon them and taking admonition from them.

a.g: So be patient, [O Muhammad]; indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And whether We show you some of what We have promised them or We take you in death, it is to Us they will be returned.

And We have already sent messengers before you. Among them are those [whose stories] We have related to you, and among them are those [whose stories] We have not related to you. And it was not for any messenger to bring a sign [or verse] except by permission of Allah. So when the command of Allah comes, it will be concluded in truth, and the falsifiers will thereupon lose [all].
It is Allah who made for you the grazing animals upon which you ride, and some of them you eat.
And for you therein are [other] benefits and that you may realize upon them a need which is in your breasts; and upon them and upon ships you are carried.
And He shows you His signs. So which of the signs of Allah do you deny?

Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? They were more numerous than themselves and greater in strength and in impression on the land, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.
And when their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they [merely] rejoiced in what they had of knowledge, but they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
And when they saw Our punishment, they said," We believe in Allah alone and disbelieve in that which we used to associate with Him."
But never did their faith benefit them once they saw Our punishment. [It is] the established way of Allah which has preceded among His servants. And the disbelievers thereupon lost [all].
